title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Houston Rockets on Saturday.
Kevin Durant led the Rockets with 26 points, as they capitalized on the Celtics' fatigue from their tight schedule.
The Celtics struggled with a 35-7 free-throw disparity and a continued shooting slump from Derrick White and Payton Pritchard.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate RB D’Ernest Johnson to active roster for Sunday's game against Atlanta Falcons.
Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury leaves Patriots' backfield thin; TreVeyon Henderson expected to start.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, also has experience as a kick returner, adding depth to special teams.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov's new partnership has improved the Boston Bruins' defensive performance.
The Zadorov-McAvoy pair has allowed only one 5-on-5 goal in 73:24 of ice time this season.
The Bruins have won their last three games, with a notable defensive improvement, including a 2-1 win over Carolina.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed just one goal in Boston Bruins' 2-1 victory over the Carolina Hurricanes.
Swayman's performance followed a rotational pivot where Joonas Korpisalo started consecutive games against Islanders and Sabres.
Swayman's save percentage of .896 still surpasses Korpisalo's .882, demonstrating strong goalkeeping amidst team defensive struggles.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox face free agency with multiple players becoming free agents, including star Alex Bregman who might opt out.
Boston could pursue key upgrades in infield positions and their pitching rotation in the upcoming offseason.
Red Sox have $218.92 million committed to payroll, close to the luxury tax threshold, influencing potential offseason moves.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game this season, previously covering their Week 2 and Week 7 wins.
The Patriots have shown unexpected success with a 6-2 record, driven by quarterback Drake Maye's standout performances.
McCourty is part of CBS's broadcast team and contributes as an NFL analyst for ESPN, leveraging his expertise on Patriots.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly interested in Miami Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips ahead of the NFL trade deadline.
Phillips, 26, is sought after by multiple teams and has 32 pressures and three sacks in recent games.
The Dolphins, who are 2-7, may trade players including Phillips for at least a third-round pick.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei has been scratched for three consecutive games as the Bruins prioritize recent defensive pairings.
Coach Marco Sturm advised Lohrei to view his sidelining as a learning opportunity to improve his defensive play.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Nikita Zadorov's pairing with Charlie McAvoy have improved Bruins' defensive performance.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Atlanta Falcons enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 3-4 record, aiming to improve their playoff chances.
Falcons' running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and poses a dual-threat as a receiver.
The Falcons' defense ranks second in the league in yards allowed per game, with a strong secondary led by A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez led the Dodgers to a 3-1 win over the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, giving the Dodgers a crucial 3-0 lead.
Hernandez's defensive play in the ninth sealed the victory, preventing Toronto's comeback attempt.
